atlantic.title: Texas Has Legally Married One Gay Couple
atlantic.topComment: The optics of trying to invalidate the marriage of a woman with cancer is just awful. Even if you can't appeal to them based on human decency, I would think their political instincts would be good enough to see that as a lose-lose for them.

atlantic.title: Eggs Are Back: The Elegant Simplicity of the New Diet Guidelines
atlantic.topComment:
Eggs never left my table, nor did whole milk, red meat or salt or sugar. Aspartame - not a chance in hell would I consume that - right up there with HFCS. Whole milk is 3% fat -
then there are those crappy watered down versions - 2% & 1%

atlantic.title: King David
atlantic.topComment: Beautiful piece. At my high school, we have something called recovery. Knuckleheads who have missed more than ten days of a class have to "recover" those classes. Mostly they just sit in a room, or clean erasers.

atlantic.title: What Does It Mean for Obama to Love or Hate America?
atlantic.topComment: Not sure why someone who doesn't love America brought down its unemployment rate to 5.7% and provided health care for uninsured folk. At this rate we should get some Al Qaeda clown into the Oval Office so we can really get stuff done.
